foodies.name: Sam’s Bar-B-Que
foodies.description: No-frills landmark covered in memorabilia serving brisket, ribs & mutton in a straight-up manner.
foodies.body: No-frills landmark covered in memorabilia serving brisket, ribs & mutton in a straight-up manner. Some of the most tender meat you’ll try. A local hangout for black Austinites and one of the most authentic places left from East Austin’s segregated era. They prefer cash to card.

foodies.name: Fonda San Miguel
foodies.description: Sophisticated takes on traditional Mexican cuisine served in a colorful, hacienda-style space.
foodies.body: Sophisticated takes on traditional Mexican cuisine served in a colorful, hacienda-style space. One of the best dining atmospheres in Austin and the food is delicious.
foodies.address: 2330 W N Loop Blvd, Austin, TX 78756

foodies.name: The Tavern
foodies.description: German-influenced sports bar boasting 50 high-def TVs, a rotating beer menu & an upstairs patio.
foodies.body: German-influenced sports bar boasting 50 high-def TVs, a rotating beer menu & an upstairs patio. Established in 1916, it’s been serving Austin locals for over a century. Some say it’s even haunted.
